article: A young, rich girl was getting ready  _  bed when she  heard  a low crying coming  _  her window. She went over to the window and leaned out,  Another  girl was standing there. It was a cold winter, but the girl had no quilt , only old newspapers. The rich girl suddenly came up with a helpful idea. She told her to go to her front door. The homeless girl was  _  and she could only manage  to nod  .There she gave her a(an)  _  quilt and a pillow . Watching the true happiness alight upon the other girl's face, she went to bed happily. The next morning a knock came on the door. The rich girl flew to the door. She opened it and found the little girl. Her face looked  _  , and she smiled,. "I  _  you want these back." The rich little girl opened her mouth just saying that she could keep them when another idea appeared in her mind ," "Yes , I want them back. "The homeless girl said , "Thank you!", laid down the things , and turned to leave when the rich girl shouted, " Wait! Stay right there." She saw the rich girl  _  up the stairs and then turn back quickly. She brought a new quilt and a pillow to her. " Have these," she said  _  . These were her own personal belongs( )  made of  silk and down feathers. One day, the rich girl ,  _  was now a rich woman got a call from a lawyer ( ), who told her: Forty years ago , when she was nine years old ,she helped a  _  girl in need. That girl grew into a  _  woman with a husband. She had recently died and left something for her in her will: It was a new pillow with diamonds and a wool quilt with gold thread .
